title: change bank account numbers

profile.name: Gratipay
profile.about: Gratitude? Gratipay! The easiest way for your company to pay for open source.

vulnerability_information: I leaked our bank account numbers for PNC and New Alliance in screenshots on https://github.com/gratipay/inside.gratipay.com/issues/308. They were up for about six days (and will have gone out in email to Gratipay contributors and watchers). I've removed the screenshots from the comments, but they're still up on the GitHub CDN.
vulnerability_information_html: I leaked our bank account numbers for PNC and New Alliance in screenshots on https://github.com/gratipay/inside.gratipay.com/issues/308. They were up for about six days (and will have gone out in email to Gratipay contributors and watchers). I've removed the screenshots from the comments, but they're still up on the GitHub CDN.

activities.message: I've deleted the account numbers entirely from Xero. They were only useful for automated sync-ups, and I don't think we should do automated sync-ups anyway (for reasons of security and control).
activities.markdown_message: I've deleted the account numbers entirely from Xero. They were only useful for automated sync-ups, and I don't think we should do automated sync-ups anyway (for reasons of security and control).

activities.message: And now we're not using Xero at all. Still need to roll our bank account numbers though ...
activities.markdown_message: And now we're not using Xero at all. Still need to roll our bank account numbers though ...

activities.message:
Okay, I called PNC and talked to someone. The way to get a new account number is to close the existing account and open a new one. I called New Alliance but didn't leave a message. Let's assume it'll be the same. The process, then, is to:

1. open new accounts
1. move half the money over
1. update all relevant systems to point to the new accounts
1. move the rest of the money over
1. close the old accounts
activities.markdown_message:
Okay, I called PNC and talked to someone. The way to get a new account number is to close the existing account and open a new one. I called New Alliance but didn't leave a message. Let's assume it'll be the same. The process, then, is to:

  1. open new accounts
  2. move half the money over
  3. update all relevant systems to point to the new accounts
  4. move the rest of the money over
  5. close the old accounts

activities.message: @whit537, any updates on this?
activities.markdown_message: @whit537, any updates on this?

activities.message: I stopped by New Alliance today. Since we changed our EIN a while ago I need to bring a printout of that with me in order to open a new account. The procedure is to open a new account, migrate to it, and then close the old one. Same procedure w/ PNC.
activities.markdown_message: I stopped by New Alliance today. Since we changed our EIN a while ago I need to bring a printout of that with me in order to open a new account. The procedure is to open a new account, migrate to it, and then close the old one. Same procedure w/ PNC.

activities.message: Thanks for the update @whit537!
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for the update @whit537!

activities.message:
I've opened a new bank account at New Alliance. The next step will be to a) transfer some funds over, and b) link the new account in PayPal and Braintree. At that point we can start using it for weekly payday before moving the rest of our funds over there and finally closing the old account.

Also, PNC.
activities.markdown_message:
I've opened a new bank account at New Alliance. The next step will be to a) transfer some funds over, and b) link the new account in PayPal and Braintree. At that point we can start using it for weekly payday before moving the rest of our funds over there and finally closing the old account.

Also, PNC.

activities.message: The new account is not yet linked on their web app. I'm going to give it a day or two to show up before following up with them. Once it's linked I will look at PayPal and Braintree.
activities.markdown_message: The new account is not yet linked on their web app. I'm going to give it a day or two to show up before following up with them. Once it's linked I will look at PayPal and Braintree.

activities.message: I stopped in at PNC today and figured out who I need to talk to and what documentation I need to provide.
activities.markdown_message: I stopped in at PNC today and figured out who I need to talk to and what documentation I need to provide.

activities.message: I stopped in at PNC today and figured out who I need to talk to and what documentation I need to provide.
activities.markdown_message: I stopped in at PNC today and figured out who I need to talk to and what documentation I need to provide.

activities.message: I sent over the documentation to PNC via email and then stopped by, but the guy is out with bronchitis(!).
activities.markdown_message: I sent over the documentation to PNC via email and then stopped by, but the guy is out with bronchitis(!).

activities.message: I have a meeting with PNC scheduled for April 19.
activities.markdown_message: I have a meeting with PNC scheduled for April 19.

activities.message: I met with PNC and opened a new account. It should be online tomorrow with a new card arriving in a few days or so. Once we have that we can start moving vendors over to the new account.
activities.markdown_message: I met with PNC and opened a new account. It should be online tomorrow with a new card arriving in a few days or so. Once we have that we can start moving vendors over to the new account.

activities.message: I've received the new debit card. Will activate when I'm ready to switch vendors to it.
activities.markdown_message: I've received the new debit card. Will activate when I'm ready to switch vendors to it.

activities.message: The new account is visible in New Alliance. I've transferred approximately half our escrow ($50,000) over to it. There appears to be a bug whereby I am unable to change the nicknames on the accounts (I've tried in Chrome and FF).
activities.markdown_message: The new account is visible in New Alliance. I've transferred approximately half our escrow ($50,000) over to it. There appears to be a bug whereby I am unable to change the nicknames on the accounts (I've tried in Chrome and FF).

activities.message: https://articles.braintreepayments.com/reference/account-information
activities.markdown_message: https://articles.braintreepayments.com/reference/account-information

activities.message: Contacted Braintree support in https://gratipay.freshdesk.com/helpdesk/tickets/8455.
activities.markdown_message: Contacted Braintree support in https://gratipay.freshdesk.com/helpdesk/tickets/8455.

activities.message:
Heard back from Braintree. We need to provide a bank letter as follows:

> - Must include the name of your bank
> - It must be on bank letterhead
> - Must include the name of your business
> - ABA/routing number and account number
> - Signature of a bank representative
> - CANNOT be a direct deposit form
activities.markdown_message:
Heard back from Braintree. We need to provide a bank letter as follows:

  • Must include the name of your bank
  • It must be on bank letterhead
  • Must include the name of your business
  • ABA/routing number and account number
  • Signature of a bank representative
  • CANNOT be a direct deposit form

activities.message: I've transferred approximately half of our operating balance into the new PNC account ($750 + the $100 used to open the account = $850 total in there) and I am updating our card for our [recurring vendors](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1p3DpF9ZLEsViBx0685FwJaYN1vVScKVUgXHb2zyqXZg/edit#gid=1).
activities.markdown_message: I've transferred approximately half of our operating balance into the new PNC account ($750 + the $100 used to open the account = $850 total in there) and I am updating our card for our recurring vendors.

activities.message: Okay! I am done updating our card info for all of our recurring vendors. The next step is to switch PayPal to deposit to the new PNC account.
activities.markdown_message: Okay! I am done updating our card info for all of our recurring vendors. The next step is to switch PayPal to deposit to the new PNC account.

activities.message: I've linked PNC to PayPal and have started the verification process. Once verification is complete I'll need to double-check that our automatic clearing is still intact.
activities.markdown_message: I've linked PNC to PayPal and have started the verification process. Once verification is complete I'll need to double-check that our automatic clearing is still intact.

activities.message: I've also begun the verification process for linking our new New Alliance account to our other PayPal account.
activities.markdown_message: I've also begun the verification process for linking our new New Alliance account to our other PayPal account.

activities.message: I flubbed both verifications. For escrow I put in our savings account number instead of our checking account number. For operations I left a digit off the end of our account number. I've removed those bad links and started over.
activities.markdown_message: I flubbed both verifications. For escrow I put in our savings account number instead of our checking account number. For operations I left a digit off the end of our account number. I've removed those bad links and started over.

activities.message:
I've verified the PNC account and configured autosweep in PayPal.

I'm still waiting for the verification deposits to hit New Alliance.
activities.markdown_message:
I've verified the PNC account and configured autosweep in PayPal.

I'm still waiting for the verification deposits to hit New Alliance.

activities.message: I got a bank letter from New Alliance and have uploaded it to Braintree.
activities.markdown_message: I got a bank letter from New Alliance and have uploaded it to Braintree.

activities.message: Account is supposedly updated at Braintree. Will watch for deposits to land in the new account.
activities.markdown_message: Account is supposedly updated at Braintree. Will watch for deposits to land in the new account.

activities.message:
I've confirmed our New Alliance escrow account at PayPal. Tomorrow's processing run should pull from there.

If tomorrow Braintree deposits to New Alliance and PayPal pulls from New Alliance ... then I will wait for the same to occur next week. If it works two weeks in a row I will move the rest of the balance to the new account and close the old one.

I'll close the old PNC after a week or so of activity against the new account as well.

Almost there!
activities.markdown_message:
I've confirmed our New Alliance escrow account at PayPal. Tomorrow's processing run should pull from there.

If tomorrow Braintree deposits to New Alliance and PayPal pulls from New Alliance ... then I will wait for the same to occur next week. If it works two weeks in a row I will move the rest of the balance to the new account and close the old one.

I'll close the old PNC after a week or so of activity against the new account as well.

Almost there!

activities.message: I've closed the old PNC account. It had no activity since May 31.
activities.markdown_message: I've closed the old PNC account. It had no activity since May 31.

activities.message: Braintree has landed in the new account at New Alliance. Ready to close out the old one.
activities.markdown_message: Braintree has landed in the new account at New Alliance. Ready to close out the old one.

activities.message: I've initiated a $100 transfer from New Alliance to PayPal to ensure the connection is working.
activities.markdown_message: I've initiated a $100 transfer from New Alliance to PayPal to ensure the connection is working.

activities.message:
I stopped by PNC for a paper copy of our May statement for the old account, because I didn't download it before closing the account.

I stopped by New Alliance and moved all of the money out of the old account into the new account. My wife's name is also on the old account (it's an ooooollldd account). She and I are heading over there now to close it.
activities.markdown_message:
I stopped by PNC for a paper copy of our May statement for the old account, because I didn't download it before closing the account.

I stopped by New Alliance and moved all of the money out of the old account into the new account. My wife's name is also on the old account (it's an ooooollldd account). She and I are heading over there now to close it.

activities.message: Okay! We closed the old New Alliance account! I believe that completes our odyssey here. Thanks for your patience, everyone.
activities.markdown_message: Okay! We closed the old New Alliance account! I believe that completes our odyssey here. Thanks for your patience, everyone.

activities.message: I've unlinked the old New Alliance account from PayPal and have promoted the new account to be primary.
activities.markdown_message: I've unlinked the old New Alliance account from PayPal and have promoted the new account to be primary.

activities.message: It looks like autosweep is not functioning from PayPal operations to PNC, even though it appears to be configured properly. I've gone through the configuration workflow again and it says "You have successfully activated Auto-Sweep." Will check again ...

activities.message: I see the sweep from PayPal in funds on hold in PNC. Should be available in a few days.
